title: Developer still hopeful for multi-story bed and breakfast in Hoover - WBRC
content:
HOOVER, Ala. (WBRC) - After Hoover passed its ordinance banning short term rentals in residential neighborhoods, realtor and developer Jordan Masaeid-Hosey has been busy putting together a plan for a 5-story bed and breakfast in Trace Crossings.

Hosey tells us the project will be a high-end property with fine dining, breakfast, spa, playground for the kids, a roof top bar among other amenities. Hosey wants to build the 18-suite bed and breakfast across from Brock’s Gap Brewing.

Right now, she’s hoping to have everything packaged up to pitch to the city by the end of June. Hosey wants to create an experience like Hoover has never seen before

“It just brings all those components together where the traveler can really be just a commuter, a walker to access all those great amenities that the Trace Crossings neighborhood has to offer,” Hosey said.

Hosey is also interviewing potential investors. We’re told the project must receive city approval.

Hosey is about to open Buck Creek BNB, a boutique bed and breakfast in Helena.

Get news alerts in the Apple App Store and Google Play Store or subscribe to our email newsletter here.

Copyright 2023 WBRC. All rights reserved.

title: Binance Australia Loses Crypto Ramp PayID ‘With Immediate Effect’ - Decrypt
content:
We do the research, you get the alpha! Get exclusive reports and access to key insights on airdrops, NFTs, and more! Subscribe now to Alpha Reports and up your game! Go to Alpha Reports

Decrypt’s Art, Fashion, and Entertainment Hub. Discover SCENE

Binance’s Australian branch today announced that it is “unable to facilitate PayID deposits” for its users.

The crypto exchange attributed the loss of the onramp “to a decision made by our third-party payment service provider” and says bank transfer withdrawals have also been affected.

Cuscal is reportedly the service provider in question. "At Cuscal we are focussed on supporting the industry in protecting Australians from financial crimes and scams," a Cuscal spokesperson told Decrypt. "We don’t have a comment on any other parties at this point."

AD

AD

PayID is a domestic payments organization that lets users give a memorable piece of information to receive payments–like mobile numbers or email addresses–instead of bank account numbers.

“We are working hard to find an alternative provider to continue offering AUD deposits and withdrawals to our users,” the announcement read.

The news comes over a month after the Australian Securities and Investments Commission (ASIC) canceled the exchange’s license for its derivatives business following a request from the exchange itself, which will use the winding down to “pursue a more focused approach.”

Binance and PayID did not immediately respond to Decrypt’s request for comment.

Choppy waters for Binance

The world’s busiest exchange is currently the subject of investigations by at least four different U.S. government agencies, including the SEC, DOJ, IRS and, most recently, the CFTC.

AD

AD

Back in March, the leading derivatives regulator, the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC), filed a lawsuit with a Chicago federal court accusing Binance of unauthorized derivatives trading by offering futures, swaps, and options on leading cryptocurrencies.

The suit also accuses the exchange of having insufficient anti-money laundering (AML) and know-your-customer (KYC) controls and allegedly evading or helping U.S. clients evade regulators.

At the end of April, reports emerged that Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao has hired lawyers to defend himself against the multiple legal threats.

Around then, bankrupt crypto lender Voyager said Binance.US axed a deal to acquire the company’s assets. Voyager was one of the high-profile casualties of Terra’s collapse last May.

In a statement to Decrypt at the time, Binance cited “the hostile and uncertain regulatory climate in the United States” as the main reason behind the decision to back out.

title: 11 Charming Bed And Breakfasts Around Central Ohio - Columbus Navigator
content:
There is something about staying in a quaint little bed and breakfast that makes for the perfect weekend.

Between the food and the ambiance, a bed and breakfast can be the best way to kick back and recover from the workweek. But sadly, we don’t all have tons of vacation days laying around.

Well, good news. You don’t have to take a whole week off to enjoy a little getaway. Here are 11 bed and breakfasts all within an hour’s drive, and we’ve ranked them by price from low to high.

The Lily Stone Bed and Breakfast

About: Run by the Gahanna Historical Society, this B&B is within walking distance of downtown Olde Gahanna. It’s a short drive from the airport so it makes a cozy place for out-of-towners to hunker down for a night or two.

Address: 106 S. High Street, Gahanna, Ohio 43230

Website: The Lily Stone Bed and Breakfast

About: Ohio’s longest operating inn and tavern, the Buxton Inn opened in 1812. When you stay at the Buxton Inn, you’re staying in a bit of history. Famous former patrons include President William H. Harrison, who was the first of three presidents to stay at the inn.

Address: 313 E Broadway, Granville, OH 43023

Website: The Historical Buxton Inn

50 Lincoln Short North Bed and Breakfast

About: 50 Lincoln Short North Bed and Breakfast received a Trip Advisor Certificate of Excellence in 2016. The B&B is in the heart of the Short North which grants visitors easy access to everything the Arts District has to offer. Check into 50 Lincoln and then hit up the shops, restaurants, and bars.

Address: 50 E Lincoln St, Columbus, OH 43215

Website: 50 Lincoln Short North Bed and Breakfast

Granville Inn

About: The Granville Inn looks like something out of a movie. A very castle-like B&B, the Granville Inn is a remarkable place to stay or host an event. This bed and breakfast is on the larger side and offers 36 guest rooms and 3 suites for visitors to enjoy. The inn is located in Granville near all the shops and places to eat that you could ever need.

Address: 314 E Broadway First Floor, Granville, OH 43023

Website: Granville Inn

Emma’s Bed & Breakfast

About: This old farmhouse was originally built in 1833, and is a less than 40-minute drive from Columbus. Check into the B&B and take a walk on the walking trails around the house, visit the salon and spa, or head out for a tour of Frank Lloyd Wright’s Wescott House.

Address: 4200 E National Rd, Springfield, OH 45505

Website: Emma’s Bed & Breakfast

Winter St. Inn

About: Nestled in the heart of Downtown Delaware, this charming inn perfectly captures its 143-year history. The B&B is just north of Columbus, making it the perfect getaway. Enjoy the shops and restaurants in Delaware or spend your time relaxing around the Inn.

Address: 185 W Winter St, Delaware, OH 43015

Website: Winter St. Inn

Orchard House Bed and Breakfast

About: Voted one of the top three inns in the state by the Ohio Hotel and Lodging Association, Orchard House will give you a rustic farmhouse feel, with all the luxuries you could need. With amenities such as complimentary locally made skin care products, different stay packages, and a stunning, wooded outdoor wedding chapel, the Orchard House is well worth a visit.

Address: 4058 Columbus Rd, Granville, OH 43023

Website: Orchard House Bed and Breakfast

Timbrook Guesthouse

About: The list of amazing amenities at The Timbrook Guesthouse is a long one. Some of them include a hot soaking spa, a pool, an orchid green house, a tropical aviary, and cozy common rooms. Another perk is the B&B’s proximity to Antrim Park. You can walk a couple laps around the lake to work off all the delicious food you’ll be guzzling down at Timbrook.

Address: 5811 Olentangy River Rd, Columbus, OH 43235

Website: Timbrook Guesthouse

Castle Inn Bed & Breakfast

About: Who knew that you could feel like royalty by driving less than 45 minutes to this regal inn? The castle was built in 1895 by Samuel Ruggles. Today, it offers all the modern amenities that you could hope for and each room is unique. On the last Friday of the month (Jan-Nov), the Castle Inn B&B offers “Central Ohio’s Best Murder Mystery.”

Address: 610 S Court St, Circleville, OH 43113

Website: Castle Inn Bed & Breakfast

Bexley Bed and Breakfast

About: A short walk to Main Street in downtown Bexley, the Bexley B&B has a sweet location. It is a wonderful place for the family of Capital University to stay when they come to visit. You can practically see the Drexel Theatre and Graeter’s Ice Cream from the front porch. What’s not to like?

Address: 519 S Drexel Ave, Bexley, OH 43209

Website: Bexley Bed and Breakfast

The Welsh Hills Inn

About:The Welsh Hills Inn sits on 15 acres of historic farmland in Granville, Ohio. Aside from the luxurious rooms, the inn offers amenities such as a heated pool and courtyard gardens with gorgeous views the countryside. The inn is only a 10-minute drive from the center of Granville.

Address: 2133 Cambria Mill Rd, Granville, OH 43023

Website: The Welsh Hills Inn
